intro: Torulinium samoense, commonly known as the Samoan torula, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to the tropical climate of the Pacific Islands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked despite its ecological importance in local ecosystems.
